channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Lime bikes blocking parking bays of car on Manchester Square, 24th September
item.description:
Lime bikes blocking parking bays of cars at Manchester Square opposite 14 need to fix it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Manchester Square, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: BIG DEEP POTHOLE IN THE ROAD O/S No 14, 24th September
item.description:
Resident reporting there is a potholoe o/s her property which is now needing urgent attention as it was reported 2 months ago & Bexley contractors came down & marked the area and contractors were going to be contacted immediately to complete the work however no one has been back & the pothole is getting deeper and more dangerous if someone falls into the pothole as it is a pedestrian walkway. Please could someone look into this again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Longworth Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Building works blocking pavement, 24th September
item.description:
Building works have blocked the pavement and diverted pedestrians across the road. This is very unsafe as there is no pedestrian crossing and large quantities of traffic and cyclists moving up and down the road. This is on the corner of Cornwall Road and The Cut.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Cut, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flat 139 Lee Road usual fly tipping, 24th September
item.description:
When are the tenants in this flat going to be addressed for this constant mess outside their doorway This has been like this for days now, not been collected at night by the council like it should - Why do the resisters around here have to suffer with this ? Are the council going to do anything about it ???

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Osborn Terrace, Horn Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken palladin and overflowing rubbish ON Fletching Road, 24th September
item.description:
This rubbish has been deliberately dumped on Fletching Road and has been there for over two weeks. Evening rubbish collections do not include this bin on their itinerary.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fletching Road, Charlton, London

item.title: Invasive Bamboo Damaging Pavement, 24th September
item.description:
Invasive Bamboo from 23 Park Avenue has travelled under the pavement and is now sprouting through the pavement breaking it up. This has been happening since Spring 2025

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Avenue, Golders Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Camera at wrong angle, 24th September
item.description:
The traffic light camera is incorrectly angled so it is necessary to pull a car forward into the bike advance line area for the camera to see that a car is there. Otherwise, the traffic light sequence skips out the Addington square traffic moving into Camberwell road. This causes long waits for cars exiting and congestion.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Addington Square, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet
